config.question: What led to a “separate sphere of domesticity” in middle-class families?

choices.content: Women no longer took up homemaking and mothering roles.
Women had dual identities, as homemakers and wage earners.
Women were cut off from their husband’s work life.
Urbanization created an egalitarian division of labor at home.

answer_2.response: Consider This: Middle-class fathers would commute to work on the new streetcars. They would leave their wives and children at home and school. See L.O. 19.2 How did the growth of American cities affect social, cultural, and political life?
